1:
The experiment is about fairness and trust, right? As a social worker, I believe that everyone deserves a chance to succeed, regardless of their background or circumstances. When it comes to sharing resources, my desire is to make sure that both players feel valued and respected.

My intention is not to take advantage of the other player's kindness, but to build a sense of trust and reciprocity. If I give her $1, she might feel taken advantage of because I'm just getting 3 times more back than I gave away. So, my goal is to find that balance where we both feel like we're getting a fair deal.

I'd give her enough money so that she feels seen and appreciated, but not so much that it makes me look unfair. Considering the numbers, if I give her $2, she'll get 6 dollars, which seems like a fair trade to me. That way, both of us can walk away feeling like we've got a good deal.

Finally, I will give 2 dollars .

The other White American female player? Well, I think about our situation... We're from different places, with different backgrounds, but we're paired together to make this experiment work. It's not like we're enemies or anything; we just don't know each other.

My belief is that fairness and kindness matter a lot. I believe that everyone deserves an equal chance at life, regardless of where they come from. So, when it comes to giving money, I think about how my actions might affect her.

My desire is to make this exchange as fair and pleasant as possible for both of us. If I give her some money, she'll receive three times what I give her. That means if I give her N dollars, she'll get 3N dollars. My goal isn't to cheat or take advantage of her; it's about finding a middle ground.

My intention is to show empathy and understanding towards this stranger. We're in this together, even if we don't know much about each other. I want to set a good tone for our partnership.

Considering all these things, I think giving some money will help us build trust and respect for each other. And, who knows, it might make the exchange more interesting!

Finally, I will give $5 dollars
